articles.headline: Climate Change Activists Either Prod Exxon Mobil or Dump It
articles.snippet: Whether to negotiate new policies reflecting climate change or adopt a scorched-earth strategy has divided groups seeking change within the energy company.
articles.abstract: Whether to negotiate new policies reflecting climate change or adopt a scorched-earth strategy has divided groups seeking change within the energy company.

articles.headline: Mt. Gox Creditors Seek Trillions Where There Are Only Millions
articles.snippet: The $2.4 trillion in bankruptcy claims against the failed Bitcoin exchange are a far cry from the $91 million in assets that have been tracked down.
articles.abstract: The $2.4 trillion in bankruptcy claims against the failed Bitcoin exchange are a far cry from the $91 million in assets that have been tracked down.

articles.headline: In Silicon Valley, Gossip, Anger and Revenge
articles.snippet: Valleywag’s posts about Peter Thiel raised his ire, and he financed a lawsuit against its parent, Gawker Media.
articles.abstract: Valleywag’s posts about Peter Thiel raised his ire, and he financed a lawsuit against its parent, Gawker Media.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Silicon Valley likes to keep the media on a tight leash. Tech executives expect obedience, if not reverence, from reporters. They dole out information as grudgingly as possible. Sometimes they simply buy a chunk of a publication, a time-honored method of influencing what is deemed fit to write about.
articles.byline: By David Streitfeld and Katie Benner

articles.headline: Peter Thiel, Tech Billionaire, Reveals Secret War With Gawker
articles.snippet: The PayPal co-founder, outed as gay in a 2007 Gawker Media blog, says his financing of a suit against the company was not motivated only by revenge.
articles.abstract: The PayPal co-founder, outed as gay in a 2007 Gawker Media blog, says his financing of a suit against the company was not motivated only by revenge.
articles.lead_paragraph: A billionaire Silicon Valley entrepreneur was outed as being gay by a media organization. His friends suffered at the hands of the same gossip site. Nearly a decade later, the entrepreneur secretly financed a lawsuit to try to put the media company out of business.

articles.headline: A Split Over Israel Threatens the Democrats’ Hopes for Unity
articles.snippet: Two people appointed by Senator Bernie Sanders to help draft the Democratic platform vowed to upend what they see as the party’s lopsided support of Israel.
articles.abstract: Two people appointed by Senator Bernie Sanders to help draft the Democratic platform vowed to upend what they see as the party’s lopsided support of Israel.
articles.lead_paragraph: A bitter divide over the Middle East could threaten Democratic Party unity as representatives of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont vowed to upend what they see as the party’s lopsided support of Israel.
articles.byline: By Jason Horowitz and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Mexican Military Runs Up Body Count in Drug War
articles.snippet: The statistics on deaths, which the government has stopped reporting, offer a rare glimpse into the Mexican military’s role in its fight against cartels.
articles.abstract: The statistics on deaths, which the government has stopped reporting, offer a rare glimpse into the Mexican military’s role in its fight against cartels.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — In the history of modern war, fighters are much more likely to injure their enemies than kill them.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Energy Plan: More Fossil Fuels and Fewer Rules
articles.snippet: Speaking in North Dakota, at the heart of America’s oil and gas boom, Mr. Trump vowed to restore coal mining jobs and “cancel” the Paris climate change accord.
articles.abstract: Speaking in North Dakota, at the heart of America’s oil and gas boom, Mr. Trump vowed to restore coal mining jobs and “cancel” the Paris climate change accord.
articles.lead_paragraph: BISMARCK, N.D. — Donald J. Trump traveled Thursday to the heart of America’s oil and gas boom, where he called for more fossil fuel drilling and fewer environmental regulations while vowing to “cancel the Paris climate agreement,” the 2015 accord committing nearly every nation to taking action to curb climate change.
articles.byline: By Ashley Parker and Coral Davenport

articles.headline: Japan’s Leader Has Little Use for Hiroshima’s Lessons of Pacifism
articles.snippet: As President Obama prepares to visit, the Asian country’s aversion to war is being challenged by a conservative movement led by Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.
articles.abstract: As President Obama prepares to visit, the Asian country’s aversion to war is being challenged by a conservative movement led by Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.
articles.lead_paragraph: HIROSHIMA, Japan — Tokyo is Japan’s political and commercial capital. Kyoto is its temple-filled repository of traditional culture. But Hiroshima — obliterated by an American atomic bomb 71 years ago, then rebuilt with a newly peaceful and prosperous country — is in many ways the heart of Japan’s modern national identity.

articles.headline: Cheap Gas for the Holiday, but Its Days Are Numbered
articles.snippet: Despite higher crude oil prices, American holiday travelers are paying the cheapest prices at the pump in 11 years.
articles.abstract: Despite higher crude oil prices, American holiday travelers are paying the cheapest prices at the pump in 11 years.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Enjoy the low gasoline prices this Memorial Day weekend while they last.
